result.execSummary:
Richard Thomas Ellis was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Richard Thomas Ellis was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard Thomas Ellis

records.addlTxt: Application for SW and Aff in Support

2:15 p.m.  Back on record.  Def has changed his mind and now wishes to proceed with extradition after looking over paperwork.  Def remembers conversation from previous hearing.  Court asks def questions.  Def understands charges in MI and right to atty.  States he is willing to proceed and acquire atty in MI, not WIm admits he is person charged in MI.  Waives review by Governor.  Court reads info on extradition form w/def who checks appropriate boxes after Court reads.  Def states he understands every question on form.  Def signs and dates form.  States no one made any threats or promises to him regarding his waiver of extradition.  States he understands more after officers explained it to him and wanted to go back into court.  2:26 p.m.  Adj.  Clerked by wmg/typed by klr

1:58 p.m.  Court calls case, cites appearances.  Defendant Richard Thomas Ellis in court, in custody.  Matthew J Tingstad appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA provides compl to def.  Ct. explains hrg to def.  Def identifies himself.  Court reads MI charges.  Def understands.  Ct. reads him rights and info on atty.  Court explains how extradition works.  Def. indicates wants atty.  Def does not waive extradition.  Court finds him to be person charged in complaint.  Court remands him to the ICJ for no more than 30 days, or until further paperwork done.  DA provides info to def on atty and extradition.  Iron Co. complaint to be filed for charges here.  Adj.  2:05 p.m.  Clerked by wmg/typed by klr.
